author: {'steamid': '76561198028477874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1609581306}
review:
Love this game. Phenomenal party game to play with friends and have a good time with lots of laughing. Wide array of weapons that cater to different playstyles, cool map mechanics (stage hazards) and diverse amount of maps. You need to convince at least 3 friends to play with you but if you can do that you're good to go.

The only complaints is that I've experienced a few bugs here and there. Pretty rare but on occasion you'll get spawned inside a part of the stage (adding a suicide option might alleviate this) and once or twice we couldn't move.

Overall highly recommend this game especially for the price.

[b]AT SUNDOWN: Shots in the Dark[/b] finally hits Steam, with a new and refreshing approach on multiplayer! Developed by [i]Mild Beast Games[/i], weâ€™ve been hearing about this game for almost a year, since it has been nominated for several Gaming Award categories, and winning some, particularly the [b]BAFTA Games[/b], â€œ[u]Ones to Watch[/u]â€.

Originally released on Discord store on October of 2018, [b]At Sundown[/b] quickly gained a lot of attention, but fans had to wait for other platforms such as Steam or even consoles for that matter. Going for a time-exclusivity deal has helped [i]Mild Beast Games[/i] polish the game and release a proper and final version, but what does really await us At Sundown?!

[b]At Sundown[/b] is a top shooter with stealth elements, that uses darkness and light as a way to mix the whole action into a new level of intensity. Players fight in almost complete darkness, using only shadows and specific lights to their advantages, such as lamps or throwing flares as part of the teamâ€™s gear. There are a total of 6 different maps in this current build, all arena-based where a maximum of 4 players fight for survival online.

There are 4 different characters to play with, each with a specific color. The green Dusk, the red Dawn, the yellow Midnight, and the final, the blue Eve. This makes two males and two female characters, and each represents a class, or at least, some sort of â€œpreferenceâ€. Eve is a skilful sniper, Midnight weals a blade, Dusk seems to love his shotgun, and so on, but the truth is, there are 11 weapons to unlock and equip on your favorite warrior of the night.

The wide range of weapons gives an extra satisfying motto to keep engaging in combat. The arsenal consist of basic shotgun, revolvers and auto rifles, but quickly becomes heavier with sniper, swords, grenade launcher, and if all of this is not good enough, some particular weapons are at your disposal, such as a very special umbrella, a shock-bow and even a juggernaut with a devastating swing!Â All of these weapons look extremely amazing to use against your friends, but unlocking them requires some effort, not to mention learning to maneuver them!

If the above concept does sound tricky to you, do not fear, thereâ€™s a training ground ready for all your knowledge to be properly acquired, together with all the cool arsenal! There isa total of 24 challenges that goes through every and each weapon available within the game.Â Each challenge is composed of two levels, the basic challenge and the advanced one. The goal is to teach players all the skills of the game, rewarding the performance with medals from Bronze, to Silver and finally Gold, which is the highest rank. XP is unlocked based on the medals earned, and the more experience points, the more goodies are earned.

Created with Unity, [b]At Sundown[/b] shows a huge customization, while in-game. Full controller support, with remapping ability, even for extra mouse buttons, which is always pleasant. We should also take a moment to appreciate the lack of chromatic aberration being forced down to customers, and also, since weâ€™re on the matter, the Bloom effect can also be toggled off. Same goes for Blood and Bodies from within the game.Â Other options such as VSync and Anti-Aliasing are also present. Overall Graphics Quality and Visuals can be changed from Low to Medium and High, and shadows can further be reduced.

Overall, and entering into technical details, I personally noticed no frame rate drops while playing with the High setting, on a GTX 750 Ti, which is now a Low tier card, but still performs very well in this game, and generally speaking, the Unity engine doesnâ€™t go along low-tier cards based on nVidiaâ€™s Maxwell architecture. If anything, we must make reference to the fantastic optimization made by [i]Mild Beast Games[/i]!

Playing online or with local friends, one thing is surely certain, thereâ€™s fun waiting for you At Sundown, and might just take some time to learn and gain reflexes, but once you do, the learning progress will become simpler and rewarding. Disclaimer: I played this game a lot during the PC beta (free invite from devs), and just got it for my Switch today (paid myself). On to the review...

Ok so you'll definitely have fun playing this game with your friends/family, it's really simple to pick up and have fun with different weapons. If you like Towerfall or Gang Beasts this is similar but with more variety/replayability. You'll want to own some controllers if you want to play local through steam.

But this game _really_ gets good once you get past the intial learning and get into the M I N D  G A M E S. I love playing a unpredictable mix of stealth and speed. Your opponent gets scared that you are sneaking right next to them so they shoot blindly giving away their position. Then when they drop their guard, you rush right at them. 
Would love crossplay between platforms of course, but playing locally on a single screen is the most fun anyway imo.
